title: SoC CSD 444-0-1 Development and Disorders of Mathematics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Theory and research on math development and disorders. Identification, assessment and remediation of disorders of mathematics and related areas.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Upon successful completion of all course requirements, students will:

  1. understand the different paradigms that have been utilized in research in math L.D.

  2. understand the relation between normal and atypical cognitive development and mathematics achievement

  3. know the various types of mathematics curricula commonly in use today, and their strengths and weaknesses

  4. be able to administer, score, and interpret several commonly utilized standardized tests of mathematics

  5. be able to conduct error analyses on a range of formal and informal mathematics tests

  6. be able to identify, determine underlying causes of, and provide appropriate remedial approaches for math fact deficits, difficulties in solving math story problems, and problems involving time and money

  7. be able to select appropriate manipulatives and utilize them effectively in teaching math concepts

  8. understand the role linguistic factors play in math achievement, and be able to utilize this information in planning appropriate remedial activities

  9. understand gender, cultural, and social factors that may impact on the math achievement of some individuals.
